page.title: 17Grafham Water Nature Trails.
page.content: Two{nature trails}have been laid out within the nature reserve. The first starts at the west end of the Mander car park at the south west end of the reservoir. The {short trail}is about three quarters of a mile while the{long trail}is double the length. The{bird hide}administered by the Beds and Hunts Naturalist Trust is situated on this trail overlooking Grafham Water. The second trail, the{Savages {Spinney Nature Trail,}is on the north west shores of the reservoir. Access is from the Hill Farm car park and the trail covers some three and a half miles and passes through Savages Spinney, an old and well-established woodland. This wood is frequented by Muntjac Deer whose tracks may be seen in the soft mud.
